title: Job Openings at Prohuman Capital Consulting
content:
(adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    

Prohuman Capital Consulting is a dynamic HR consulting firm dedicated to empowering organizations with comprehensive human resources expertise and strategic guidance. Founded on the principle that exceptional talent management drives business success, we partner with companies to navigate their most complex HR challenges and unlock their human capital potential. Our reach extends to companies in and around West Africa, where we do business with diverse organizations seeking strategic HR solutions. At Prohuman Capital Consulting, we believe that every organization is unique. Our consultative approach begins with understanding your specific business context, industry dynamics, and organizational culture. We then develop customized solutions that are practical, implementable, and measurable.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Accountant

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Position Overview


	We are seeking a detail-oriented Accountant to manage the financial records and transactions of our retail store in Lagos.
	This mid-level position involves handling daily accounting operations, preparing financial reports, and ensuring accurate record-keeping in compliance with accounting standards.


Key Responsibilities
Daily Accounting Operations:


	Record daily sales transactions and cash receipts
	Process invoices, payments, and vendor bills
	Reconcile daily cash and bank transactions
	Manage petty cash and expense reimbursements
	Monitor accounts receivable and payable.


Financial Reporting:


	Prepare monthly financial statements and reports
	Generate profit and loss statements
	Reconcile bank statements and general ledger accounts
	Prepare tax returns and statutory remittances (VAT, WHT, PAYE)
	Maintain accurate financial records and documentation.


Inventory & Stock Management:


	Monitor inventory records and stock values
	Reconcile physical stock counts with accounting records
	Track cost of goods sold and inventory movements
	Prepare inventory reports for management review.


Payroll & Staff Matters:


	Process monthly staff salaries and wages
	Calculate and remit staff taxes and pension contributions
	Maintain payroll records and employee financial files
	Handle salary advances and loan deductions.


Compliance & Administration:


	Ensure compliance with tax regulations and filing deadlines
	Liaise with auditors and tax authorities when required
	Maintain proper filing of financial documents
	Support budget preparation and financial planning.


Required Qualifications
Education & Professional Certification:


	HND / Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field
	2-4 years of accounting experience
	ATS/ICAN in view or partially completed (desirable)
	Retail or FMCG experience preferred.


Technical Skills:


	Proficiency in accounting software (QuickBooks, Sage, Tally, or similar)
	Good knowledge of Microsoft Excel and Office Suite
	Understanding of VAT, WHT, and PAYE regulations
	Familiarity with basic bookkeeping principles
	Knowledge of financial reporting standards.


Personal Competencies:


	Strong attention to detail and accuracy
	Good analytical and numerical skills
	Honest and trustworthy with high integrity
	Ability to meet deadlines and work under pressure
	Good organizational and time management skills
	Basic communication skills for reporting.


Salary
N100,000 - N150,000 Monthly.

Application Closing Date: 25th October, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: prohumancapitalinfodesk@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: We appreciate all applications; however, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

 

 

2.) Personal Assistant

Job Location: Ebute-Metta, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Position Overview


	The Personal Assistant to the Managing Director will provide comprehensive administrative and executive support to the MD, managing schedules, communications, and key business operations to ensure smooth and efficient daily operations.


Key Responsibilities
Administrative Support:


	Manage the MD's calendar, scheduling meetings, appointments, and travel arrangements
	Screen and prioritize phone calls, emails, and correspondence on behalf of the MD
	Prepare meeting agendas, take minutes, and follow up on action items
	Organize and maintain confidential files, documents, and records
	Handle personal errands and administrative tasks as required.


Communication Management:


	Act as the primary point of contact between the MD and internal/external stakeholders
	Draft, proofread, and edit correspondence, reports, and presentations
	Coordinate communication with board members, investors, and key partners
	Manage incoming requests and inquiries with professionalism and discretion.


Project Coordination:


	Track and monitor key projects and initiatives on behalf of the MD
	Coordinate with department heads to ensure timely completion of tasks
	Prepare briefing materials and background information for meetings
	Assist in the preparation of board presentations and strategic documents.


Event Management:


	Organize corporate events, meetings, and conferences
	Coordinate logistics for company functions and executive engagements
	Liaise with vendors, caterers, and service providers.


Required Qualifications
Education & Experience:


	Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Management, or related field
	Minimum 3-5 years of experience as an Executive Assistant or Personal Assistant to senior management
	Experience in the food, FMCG, or agri-business sector is an advantage.


Skills & Competencies:


	Exceptional organizational and time management skills
	Strong written and verbal communication abilities
	High level of discretion and confidentiality
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook)
	Excellent interpersonal skills and professional demeanor
	Ability to multitask and prioritize in a fast-paced environment
	Problem-solving mindset with strong attention to detail
	Flexibility and adaptability to changing priorities.


Personal Attributes:


	Proactive and self-motivated
	Trustworthy and reliable
	Professional appearance and conduct
	Strong work ethic and positive attitude
	Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary package
	Opportunity to work closely with executive leadership
	Professional development opportunities
	Dynamic work environment in a growing Nigerian agri-business
	Exposure to strategic business operations.


Application Closing Date: 20th October, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: prohumancapitalinfodesk@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: We appreciate all applications; however, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

 

3.) Sales Representative

Job Location: Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Position Overview


	The Sales Representative will be responsible for driving sales growth in the Abuja region by identifying new business opportunities, building strong customer relationships, and achieving sales targets for Pachamama Foods' range of healthy food products.


Key Responsibilities
Sales & Business Development:


	Identify and develop new sales opportunities in Abuja and surrounding areas
	Build and maintain relationships with retailers, distributors, supermarkets, and institutional clients
	Conduct market research to identify potential customers and emerging market trends
	Present and promote Pachamama Foods' product range to prospective clients
	Negotiate pricing, contracts, and terms with customers
	Achieve and exceed monthly and quarterly sales targets.


Customer Relationship Management:


	Maintain regular contact with existing customers to ensure satisfaction and repeat business
	Address customer inquiries, concerns, and complaints promptly and professionally
	Provide product information, samples, and demonstrations to clients
	Gather customer feedback and communicate insights to management
	Build long-term partnerships with key accounts.


Territory Management:


	Develop and implement sales strategies for the Abuja territory
	Plan and execute daily sales routes and customer visits efficiently
	Monitor competitor activities and market conditions
	Maintain accurate records of sales activities, customer interactions, and pipeline in CRM system
	Prepare regular sales reports and forecasts for management.


Product Promotion:


	Organize and participate in promotional events, trade shows, and product demonstrations
	Ensure proper product placement and visibility in retail locations
	Educate customers on the benefits and features of Pachamama Foods products
	Distribute marketing materials and promotional items.


Required Qualifications
Education & Experience:


	Minimum OND/HND/Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business Administration, or related field
	2-4 years of proven sales experience, preferably in the food, FMCG, or consumer goods industry
	Demonstrated track record of meeting or exceeding sales targets
	Knowledge of the Abuja market and existing business networks is a strong advantage.


Skills & Competencies:


	Strong sales and negotiation skills
	Excellent communication and presentation abilities
	Customer-focused mindset with strong relationship-building skills
	Self-motivated with the ability to work independently
	Good organizational and time management skills
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
	Valid driver's license (preferred)
	Ability to use CRM software and sales tools.


Personal Attributes:


	Results-driven and target-oriented
	Enthusiastic and persuasive
	Professional and presentable appearance
	Resilient and able to handle rejection
	Team player with a collaborative spirit
	Integrity and ethical approach to business.


Application Closing Date: 20th October, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: prohumancapitalinfodesk@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
